intro: Oxytropis arctobia, commonly known as bearbane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its upright growth habit and yellow to orange flowers. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes, and is adapted to harsh environmental conditions. Oxytropis arctobia is also known for its historical use by indigenous peoples for medicinal purposes.
